title: Peasholm Park Walking Route

images.title: Alan Walker / Peasholm Park Illuminations and the Tree Walk
images.caption: Peasholm Park Illuminations and the Tree Walk. The historic photograph shows parts of Peasholm lake, the Tree Walk and the illuminations during the summer of 1973. The pagoda at the top of the island is the source of a cascade, which can be seen in this photograph coloured blue and green and running toward the left.

images.title: Peasholm Glen. Peasholm Park by N Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Peasholm Glen. A view of the nice surfaced footpath through the glen.

images.title: John Davis / Southern entrance to Peasholm Park
images.caption: Southern entrance to the park. This is the entrance to the park is at the corner of Peasholm Dr and Columbus Ravine. Visible are some of the concessions within the park as well as the lake.

images.title: Peasholm Park - Waterfall by Betty Longbottom, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Waterfall view.

images.title: Dragon Garden, Peasholm Park by N Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Dragon Garden and sculpture.

images.title: Peasholm Park - Lily Pond by Betty Longbottom, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Lily pond with statue.

images.title: Wishing Well, Peasholm Park by N Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Wishing Well.

description: Enjoy a walk along tree lined paths in this delightful park in Scarborough. The park has nice surfaced footpaths leading you to a pretty lake and gardens with an oriental theme. There's lovely little bridges over the water and a splendid Chinese Pagoda. Just across the road you can continue the walk into Royal Albert Park which leads to the North Sands beach. Just beyond there you will find Scarborough Castle which dates from the 1150s. The coastal path runs around the castle to the harbour with wonderful views over North and South Bay. To extend your walk you can pick up the Cleveland Way on the coast and try the Scarborough to Filey Walk .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: There's a nice on site cafe where you can relax and enjoy refreshments after your exercise.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The park is a lovely place for a dog walk so you'll probably see other owners with their pets on your visit. You are advised to keep them on leads though.

display_address: Peasholm Glen Bridge, Newlands, Barrowcliff, Scarborough, North Yorkshire, York and North Yorkshire, England, YO12 6AB, United Kingdom
